required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pre-hospital Ultrasound Guided Peripheral Venous Catheter Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Two Different Techniques for Ultrasound Guided Peripheral Venous Catheter Insertion in Pre-hospital Emergency Care - Randomized Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Emergency Medical Service of the Central Bohemian Region, Czech Republic

clinical_study.source: Emergency Medical Service of the Central Bohemian Region, Czech Republic

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates two different techniques for ultrasound guided peripheral venous catheter insertion in pre-hospital emergency care in comparison with conventional approach without any ultrasound guidance.

detailed_description.textblock: Peripheral venous catheter placement is one of the most common interventions in emergency medicine. When performed by conventional approach, the failure of the first attempt occurs up to 22 % and cannulation time exceed 2 minutes in up to 15 %. Ultrasound guidance of peripheral venous catheter (PVC) insertion may improve both. However, this approach has not been verified in the setting of pre-hospital emergency care so far.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of the patients with successful the first cannulation attempt of peripheral venous catheter insertion
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of the patients in which only one cannulation attempt was necessary

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of the patients with successful peripheral venous catheter insertion irrespective of the number of attempts
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of the patients in which peripheral venous catheter was inserted, irrespective of the number of attempts

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of attempts required for successful peripheral venous catheter insertion
secondary_outcome.description: The number of attempts required for successful peripheral venous catheter insertion

secondary_outcome.measure: Time required to introduce peripheral venous catheter
secondary_outcome.description: Time required to introduce peripheral venous catheter

arm_group.description: Full utrasound guidance of cathether insertion. Intervention: Ultrasound portable device used for the identification of the target vein and for the ultrasound control of proper catheter placement during the procedure of peripheral venous cannula insertion.

Catheter insertion under partial ultrasound guidance. Intervention: Ultrasound portable device used only for the identification of the target vein, the catheter placement will be done by conventional approach.
Catheter insertion by conventional approach, without ultrasound guidance

intervention.description: The target vein is directly identified by portable ultrasound device and the complete procedure of peripheral venous cathether insertion is controlled by ultrasound guidance in real time
The target vein is directly identified by ultrasound but the procedure of peripheral venous cathether insertion is performed conventionally, without ultrasound guidance
The target vein is identified and peripheral venous catheter is inserted by conventional approach without use of any guiding devices

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Awake patient indicated for peripheral venous catheter placement while treated by emergency medical service
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Coma
2. Age <18 years
3. Patient disagreement with the insertion of peripheral venous catheter
4. Disagreement of the patient with inclusion in a clinical trial
5. Contraindication of ultrasound examination of the venous system
6. Contraindication of the introduction of peripheral venous cannula on both upper limbs
7. Investigator's opinion that ultrasonic control cannulation would cause undue delay and a other procedure is required

overall_official.affiliation: Emergency Medical Service of Central Bohemian Region, Kladno, Czech republic

facility.name: Emergency Medical Service of the Central Bohemian Region

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Emergency Medical Service of the Central Bohemian Region, Czech Republic
responsible_party.investigator_title: Head physician for science and research
